p: Short-term nurses reported less often that they were providing nursing services (Mean = 11.5; SD = 3.8; Me = 12.5) than those with the longest career (Mean = 12.9; SD = 4.2; Me = 15). However, they performed more frequently for specific diagnostic tests (Mean = 8.3; SD = 5.2; Me = 10) compared to older nurses (Mean = 3.3; SD = 4.9; Me = 0). They were also more likely to prescribe specific medicinal products (Mean = 10.4; SD = 4.2; Me = 11.5) than nurses with the most seniority (Mean = 5.6; SD = 4.0; Me = 5); (Table 5).
